hero.title: End of the road? Philippine jeepneys face uncertain future
hero.description: The government's plan to phase out jeepneys in an effort to modernise the country's chaotic public transport network has put the future of the iconic vehicles in doubt.

primary.lead: El Niño's Dry Spell and the Rise in Temperature
primary.title: 'So hot you can't breathe': Extreme heat hits the Philippines
primary.description: Extreme heat scorched the Philippines, forcing schools in some areas to suspend in-person classes and prompting warnings for people to limit the amount of time spent outdoors.

secondary.title: Vendors struggle to work, fight for survival in General Santos’ sun-baked streets
secondary.description: The General Santos City government says there's no need for the city to be placed under a state of calamity because the measures in place are cushioning the impact of the El Niño phenomenon

secondary.title: 19 cars catch fire at NAIA-3 - Manila Standard
secondary.description: 50 homes razed in Pasig blaze amid rising heat index Nineteen cars caught fire at a parking area near Terminal 3 of the Ninoy Aquino International Airport (NAIA) while at least 50 houses were razed in an early morning blaze in Pasig City on Monday.

secondary.title: Heat nearing 50°C like death sentence for pets, livestock
secondary.description: MANILA, Philippines — Extreme heat, which is expected to exceed dangerous levels next month, is not only exacting a heavy toll on humans, but on animals as well.

carousel.title: Without fanfare, the Philippines is getting richer
carousel.description: And its economy is unusually well-defended against American politics

carousel.title: Scarborough Shoal was a refuge for Filipino fishermen. Then Chinese boats moved in
carousel.description: For the Philippines, the triangular chain of reefs offers a warning about China’s intentions.

carousel.title: What happens when activists are branded ‘terrorists’ in the Philippines?
carousel.description: Indigenous activists live from day to day as they try to hide from authorities and challenge designations in court.

carousel.title: Philippines Pummeled by Cyberattacks & Misinformation Tied to China
carousel.description: Volume of malicious cyber activity against the Philippines quadrupled in the first quarter of 2024 compared to the same period in 2023.
